channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024010459
item.description:
Report X-2024010459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 1137.outer container was wet.upon inspection one bottle had a loose cap leaking out approx 30 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to a loose cap resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: chemical neutralizer and fold absorb were used to address spill.

item.title: Report E-2024010096
item.description:
Report E-2024010096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: FREDERICK
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, at 0225 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Frederick, Maryland regarding the release of approximately 4 gallons of CINCHONA FLUID EXTRACT (UN1170, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The release was caused by a crack in the bottom of the pail and contained to a small area on the trailer floor and a 1â€™ x 1' area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pail containing product was placed in an overpack and forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010450
item.description:
Report X-2024010450

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: HALETHORPE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found inside of a bulk truck upside down. Once told by managers i proceeded to grab my hazardous materials cart and placed it inside the cart. DescribePack: leakage due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately taken down to the damage hazmat cage out of reach of the package handlers

item.title: Report X-2024010268

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. DescribePack: THE CAPS CAME LOOSE ON THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024010294
item.description:
Report X-2024010294

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 1144.package was dropped upon inspection one bottle was shattered leaking out 4 liters of content. DescribePack: failure was due to package being dropped resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spillage remained inside of outer container.package was placed in a hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.
